meanings.sent1: I need to recatalog my book collection to find my favorite novel.
meanings.sent2: After the library renovation, the librarian had to recatalog all the books.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally mixed up the catalog cards, so I had to recatalog them all.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumbled mess, like a library in need of a recataloging.
meanings.sent5: The task of recataloging the entire inventory seemed daunting but necessary.

meanings.definition: To organize or arrange items in a catalog again.
meanings.sent1: The store manager decided to recatalog the products for easier access.
meanings.sent2: The museum curator had to recatalog the artifacts after the exhibit was rearranged.
meanings.sent3: I had to recatalog my stamp collection after my cat knocked everything over.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like scattered pages, waiting to be recataloged into a coherent story.
meanings.sent5: The process of recataloging the files brought a sense of order to the chaos.
